title: Compile Error on apple M1
body:
- [ ] I've asked for help in the [Truffle Gitter](http://gitter.im/Consensys/truffle) before filing this issue.

---------------------------

## Issue

Fatal error when compiling contracts on M1 MacBook 

## Steps to Reproduce

```
> truffle compile
```

## Expected Behavior

Compile contracts without errors

## Actual Results

```

âœ— truffle compile

Compiling your contracts...
===========================


#
# Fatal error in , line 0
# Check failed: allocator->SetPermissions(reinterpret_cast<void*>(region.begin()), region.size(), PageAllocator::kNoAccess).
```

## Environment

* Operating System: Big Sur 11.2.1 (20D74)
* Ethereum client: geth 1.9.25
* Truffle version (`truffle version`): 5.1.65/5.1.66
* node version (`node --version`): 15.7.0
* npm version (`npm --version`): 7.4.3

Hi, I seem to still be running into the same issue on v5.2.0. I may be missing a step.

```
% truffle version

Truffle v5.2.0 (core: 5.2.0)
Solidity - >=0.6.0 <0.8.0 (solc-js)
Node v15.8.0
Web3.js v1.2.9
```

```
% truffle compile


Compiling your contracts...
===========================
```

you can update node to 15.9.0
Sounds like this is still an issue, since Truffle shouldn't require Node v15!
@UnsignedInt8 thanks for reporting the issue and we'll look into this!
I got the same one and was fixed by updating to v5.2.3

Can anyone here verify that this is/isn't an issue on the latest Truffle (currently 5.4.3)? I'm trying to see if this is still an issue for some people as I cannot reproduce it. If it is still an issue and you have reproduction steps that consistently cause this that would be super helpful!
